DataElement.preferredName: Image Study Patient Weight Float 16 Kilogram Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The weight measured in kilograms of a person undergoing a radiographic technique.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The weight of a person undergoing a radiographic technique to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Concepts.definition: A radiographic technique used to evaluate a specific anatomic location for a specific purpose.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
The vertical force exerted by a mass as a result of gravity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/13/2015 removed upside down question mark from change note. jk 2/12/09 DEC retired; new version created for change in OC concept to Image Study (C63859) requested by the VCDE Silver Review Team; only used by NCIA. 6/6/07 -DEC created to support DICOM CDE task utilizing IE DICOM Attribute terms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: DS: A string of characters representing either a fixed point number or a floating point number. A fixed point number shall contain only the characters 0-9 with an optional leading "+" or "-" and an optional "." to mark the decimal point. A floating point number shall be conveyed as defined in ANSI X3.9, with an "E" or "e" to indicate the start of the exponent. Decimal Strings may be padded with leading or trailing spaces. Embedded spaces are not allowed.  (valid characters 0-9, +,-, E,e,".") [Standard-based]_The unit of linear measure in the metric system, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). Meter is defined as the length of the path traveled by light in a vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second and is equal to 1.093 61 yards._A measure of weight. A kilogram is equal to 2.2 pounds.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).:A measure of weight. A kilogram is equal to 2.2 pounds.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).

A basic SI unit of mass. It is defined as the mass of an international prototype in the form of a platinum-iridium cylinder kept at Sevres in France. A kilogram is equal to 1,000 grams and 2.204 622 6 pounds.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/17/09 create UOM specific DICOM VR type value domain.

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 4/27/10 add to CRF CSI.  12/30/09 corrected typo in definition.  6/17/09 superseded CDE to reflect change from clinical study to image study OC concept per VCDE NCIA interim report.  3/18/08 - updated with latest verson of VD.  no type or size change
